rows.col_2:
Co-authorship on case study paper
Access to operational data (anonymized if needed)
Real-world validation of their theoretical work
Bridge publication between biology/CS and organizational design

"Research Contributor, [Institution]" credential
Academic validation of the coordination thesis
Network access to swarm intelligence / collective behavior community
Investor narrative: "Princeton/Stanford is studying our model"

Shared. They can publish. We can cite. Neither owns the other's prior work.
Trade content remains Studio 4 IP. Research findings are jointly published.

5-10 hours for initial review of Trade + research design
2-3 hours/month during production (check-ins, data review)
10-20 hours for case study co-authorship
TOTAL: ~30-50 hours over 4-6 months

Data collection embedded in librarian workflow (no extra effort)
Danilo available for 2-3 interviews about coordination theory
Flash contributor or Claude drafts the paper

No cash. This is a research collaboration.
They get publication + data + real-world case study.
If they want equity: 0.1-0.25% (advisory-level)

Option A: Informal collaboration (email agreement, co-authorship)
Option B: Research affiliate (formal letter from institution)
Option C: Advisory board member (equity + title)
Start with A, upgrade to B or C if it works.

Either party can exit at any time.
Published work remains published. Credential remains valid for work done.
No exclusivity.
